sourcesContent:
export const visa = [ { name: 'Working Visa', title: 'Working Visa / KITAS', titleDescription: 'Indonesia Visa & Immigrations Specialists', content: [ { title: '', contentDescription: `For those of you who will work or open a business or will set up your own company (PMA Company) in Indonesia, to support your daily activities later, you are required to have the right visa for you, namely a work visa / KITAS. For companies that will employ foreign workers in Indonesia, they are required to have a work permit for foreign workers “IMTA” from the Ministry of Manpower or in other words the foreign worker must have a “WORK PERMIT”. And to be able to get a “Work Permit / IMTA” the company is required to pay a “DPKK” retribution fee of USD 100 per month of service or USD 1200 for a 12 month period of service which is paid through the BANK to an account belonging to the Ministry of Manpower. Meanwhile, for a Director who owns shares in a PMA company with a minimum share size of 1.2 billion IDR, he can have an Investor Visa / KITAS valid for 2 years and at the same time have a work permit without having to pay “DPKK” funds of USD 1200/year or USD 2400/ 2 years.`, }, { title: 'Who is this type of visa for ?', contentDescription: `

This type of work visa is suitable for those of you who will work in Indonesia as a manager or regular staff, whether to carry out work activities in offices, schools, factories, mining sites, ships or at a foundation throughout Indonesia. Those who work without using a work visa will be deemed to have committed an immigration violation, namely visa abuse, and a violation of this will result in you being deported from the territory of Indonesia.

`, }, { title: 'What are the benefits of having this visa ?', contentDescription: `

If you have a work visa / KITAS and “WORK PERMIT” then you can stay and carry out work activities in Indonesia safely and comfortably, meaning you will not be questioned by the immigration authorities while you are working. And another advantage is that you can take care of / get a Certificate of Good Behavior / SKCK from the Indonesian National Police, when you need the letter one day. Many of our clients who have lived in other countries who previously lived and worked in Indonesia for a long time require a Certificate of Good Behavior / SKCK for the purpose of applying / extending their visa in the country where they currently reside, because the authorities in that country request a Police Clearence / SKCK letter from Indonesian police. There are several other advantages such as :

1. You can get a driver’s license / SIM valid for 1 year
2. You can open an account at a local bank
3. You can apply for a credit card
4. You can Register a mobile phone

`, }, { title: 'How is the procedure and how long the process is ?', contentDescription: `

This Work Visa can be applied for by applicants who are outside Indonesia (offshore) or who are already in Indonesia (Onshore). After the applicant completes all the necessary requirements, the visa can be applied immediately, either by yourself or by using the professional services of an experienced and trusted visa consultant or agent. The processing time for a work visa in normal situations ranges from 1-2 months, but during the covid-19 pandemic the process of getting a visa approval is sometimes much longer because the procedures and requirements often change.

`, }, { title: 'After the visa approval is given, how long the visa can be used ?', contentDescription: `

After your visa application has been granted by Indonesian immigration and the telex visa (e-Visa) has been issued, then you must use the visa (enter Indonesia) no later than 90 days after the visa was issued by Indonesian immigration. If during the 90 days you do not enter Indonesia, your visa will be forfeited / no longer valid. Thus you have to reapply the visa application if you want to enter Indonesia.

`, }, { title: 'Is a sponsor required to get this visa ?', contentDescription: `

True, for this visa application the applicant must first have a company that will hire/employ him in Indonesia, where the company where he works will later act as guarantor/sponsor for his work visa application. According to immigration rules, the function of the sponsor/sponsor company is as a guarantor for every foreign citizen who will stay in Indonesia, giving salary, withholding income tax and depositing it with the tax office. In addition, according to immigration rules, it is the sponsor who must be responsible for and guarantee all behavior and all living expenses while the foreigner is staying in Indonesia and must provide his return ticket back to his country of origin.

`, }, ], images: ['kitas-1.png', 'kitas-2.png', 'kitas-3.png'], card: null, content2: [ { title: 'What are the requirements to apply for this visa ?', contentDescription: `

To apply for a visa you must attach the following documents :

 

  1. Application letter & Guarantee letter
  2. Scanned colour of passport (identity page and passport cover).
  3. Passport validity period is not less than 18 months
  4. Vaccine certificate with QR code, evidence applicant is fully vaccinated.
  5. Health insurance
  6. BPJS Employment Insurance
  7. Colour passport photo with red back ground
  8. Flight ticket ( if available)
  9. Wajib Lapor Ketenagakerjaan / WLK
  10. Savings account of sponsor
  11. Curriculum Vitae / CV
  12. Certificate of degree graduated
  13. Refference Letter from previous company /work place
  14. Company organizational structure chart
  15. Legalities of sponsor company such as: Company Establishment Deed, Business License/Izin Usaha, Business Identification Number / NIB, NPWP, Director’s ID card/KTP.
`, }, ], button: null, }, { name: 'Investor Visa', title: 'Investor Visa / KITAS', titleDescription: `

This type of Investor Visa when viewed from the side of the duration of the stay, there are 2 types :

  • Index 313 - 1 year Stay Permit,
  • (for this visa, the minimum validity period of the passport is 18 months)
  • Index 314 - Residence Permit 2 years,
  • (for this visa, the minimum validity period of the passport is 30 months)
`, content: [ { title: '', contentDescription: `

This type of Investor Visa when viewed from the side of the duration of the stay, there are 2 types :

  • Index 313 – 1 year Stay Permit,
  • (for this visa, the minimum validity period of the passport is 18 months)
  • Index 314 – Residence Permit 2 years,
  • (for this visa, the minimum validity period of the passport is 30 months)
`, }, { title: 'Who is this type of visa for ?', contentDescription: `

This KITAS is only reserved for shareholders in Foreign Owned Company (PMA company) in Indonesia. With a minimum share ownership of 1.2 billion IDR, these investors can apply for and get a residence visa / KITAS valid for 2 years without being required to pay a Levy “DPKK” of USD 2400 / 2 years to the Ministry of Manpower. Thus, this investor visa/KITAS holder already has a residence permit and work permit while still being able to save funds of USD 2400/2 years due to his status as a shareholder in the company.

`, }, { title: 'What are the benefits of having this visa ?', contentDescription: `

In addition to the things mentioned above, another advantage obtained by the holder of this visa is that to get a residence visa / KITAS valid for 2 years, the process is simpler and faster, because it does not require a work permit such as RPTK & IMTA from the ministry. Manpower or letters of recommendation from other ministries, where to get it requires a long time and a fairly complicated process, as happens in the process of applying for a regular work visa. Another form of convenience is being given the opportunity to apply for a Permanent Stay Visa/KITAP which is valid for 5 years and also an opportunity to apply for Indonesian citizenship if they are interested. With the issuance of the latest regulations several years ago regarding the provision of many convenience facilities for foreign investors, the granting of this investor visa is one manifestation of the convenience provided by the government to investors. There are several other advantages such as :

  1. You can get a driver’s license / SIM valid for 2 years
  2. You can open an account at a local bank
  3. You can apply for a credit card
  4. You can get an exit permit/ MERP for two years
  5. Register a mobile phone
  6. You can own property
`, }, { title: 'How is the procedure and how long the process is ?', contentDescription: `

This Investor Visa can be applied for by applicants who are outside Indonesia (offshore) or who are already in Indonesia (Onshore). After the applicant completes all the necessary requirements, the visa can be applied immediately, either by yourself or by using the professional services of an experienced and trusted visa consultant or agent. The processing time for an Investor visa in normal situations ranges from 2 – 3 weeks, but during the covid-19 pandemic the process of getting a visa approval is sometimes much longer because the procedures and requirements often change.

`, }, { title: 'After the visa approval is given, how long the visa can be used ? ', contentDescription: `

After your visa application has been granted by Indonesian immigration and the telex visa (e-Visa) has been issued, then you must use the visa (enter Indonesia) no later than 90 days after the visa was issued by Indonesian immigration. If during the 90 days you do not enter Indonesia, your visa will be forfeited / no longer valid. Thus you have to reapply the visa application if you want to enter Indonesia.

`, }, { title: 'Is a sponsor required to get this visa ?', contentDescription: `

True, for this visa application the applicant must first have a company in the form of Foregn Owned Company / PMA and the applicant must already have shares with a minimum amount of 1.2 billion IDR and must be stated in the deed of the company that will be the sponsor.

`, }, ], images: ['kitas-4.png', 'kitas-5.png', 'kitas-3.png'], card: null, content2: [ { title: 'What are the requirements to apply for this visa ?', contentDescription: `

To apply for a visa you must attach the following documents :

 

  1. Application letter & Guarantee letter
  2. Scanned colour of passport (identity page and passport cover).
  3. Passport validity period is not less than 18 months, for a 1 year KITAS
  4. Passport validity period is not less than 30 months, for 2 years KITAS
  5. Vaccine certificate with QR code, evidence applicant is fully vaccinated.
  6. Colour passport photo, red background
  7. Flight ticket ( if available)
  8. Savings account of sponsor
  9. Legalities of sponsor company / Foreign Owned Company (PMA), such as: Company Establishment Deed, Business License/Izin Usaha, Business Identification Number / NIB, NPWP, Director’s ID card/KTP.
`, }, ], button: null, }, { name: 'Dependent Visa', title: 'Dependent Visa / KITAS', titleDescription: 'Indonesia Visa & Immigration Specialists', content: [ { title: 'How long The Validity of this kind of Visa ?', contentDescription: `This type of Dependent Visa / KITAS is valid for a stay of 1 year and can be extended every year, with 4 continuous extensions for 5 years and without having to leave the territory of Indonesia for a period of 5 years.`, }, { title: 'Who is this type of visa for ?', contentDescription: `

This type of Dependent Visa / KITAS is provided by the government for you as a foreign citizen working in Indonesia who has a wife/husband or children who will join to live with you in Indonesia as a Family. The main requirement for them to join you and be granted a visa by the Indonesian immigration authorities is if you are legally married and have a valid marriage certificate issued by the authorities in your country.

`, }, { title: 'What are the benefits of having this visa ?', contentDescription: `

If you have this type of visa, you can stay in Indonesia for 5 consecutive years without having to leave Indonesia. Among other advantages are :

1. You can get a driver’s license / SIM valid for 1 year
2. You can open an account at a local bank
3. You can apply for a credit card
4. You can get an exit permit/ MERP for 1 year
5. Register a mobile phone

`, }, { title: 'How is the procedure and how long the process is ?', contentDescription: `

This Dependent Visa / Family Visa can be applied for by applicants who are outside Indonesia (offshore) or who are already in Indonesia (Onshore). After the applicant completes all the necessary requirements, the visa can be applied immediately, either by yourself or by using the professional services of an experienced and trusted visa consultant or agent. The processing time for a Dependent visa in normal situations ranges from 1 – 2 weeks, but during the covid-19 pandemic the process of getting a visa approval is sometimes much longer because the procedures and requirements often change.

`, }, { title: 'After the visa approval is given, how long the visa can be used ? ', contentDescription: `

After your visa application has been granted by Indonesian immigration and the telex visa (e-Visa) has been issued, then you must use the visa (enter Indonesia) no later than 90 days after the visa was issued by Indonesian immigration. If during the 90 days you do not enter Indonesia, your visa will be forfeited / no longer valid. Thus you have to reapply the visa application if you want to enter Indonesia.

`, }, { title: 'Is a sponsor required to get this visa ?', contentDescription: `

True, to get this dependent visa you must be sponsored by the company where you or your partner works, so you as a spouse or parent of your children cannot be a guarantor or sponsor them to get this visa. For children who are allowed to join their parents are only children who are under 18 years old and not married.

`, }, ], images: ['kitas-7.png'], card: [ `

DEPENDENT VISA

(KITAS 1 YEAR)

7.500.000 IDR

Price Excludes
• $150 USD Mandatory Visa Fee / PNBP
• Sponsorship

Price Includes
• E-Visa Approval – From Immigration Authority
• PNBP fee / Official Visa fee to Immigration
• KITAS (Stay Permit Card) – From local immigration
• Multiple Exit Re-entry Permit / MERP – From immigration
• STM (Police Report Certificate)
• SKTT (Domicile Letter) from Civil Registry Office

Processing Time
17 Working days – (Regular Process)

Note
• The price above is valid only for the Jakarta City Area
• The price does not include express process cost (if necessary)
• Passport validity period is not less than 18 months
• House rental agreement minimum for 1 year
• Domicile letter from building management/building owner

`, ], content2: [ { title: 'What are the requirements to apply for this visa ?', contentDescription: `

To apply for a visa you must attach the following documents :

  1. Scan color passport (identity page and passport cover).
  2. Passport validity period is not less than 18 months, for a 1 year KITAS
  3. Vaccine certificate with QR code, evidence applicant is fully vaccinated.
  4. Recent photos, red background
  5. Recent photos, red background
  6. Residence address in Indonesia
  7. Marriage Certificate
  8. Birth Certificate for children
  9. Flight ticket ( if available)
  10. Savings account of sponsor
  11. Legalities of sponsor company such as: Company Establishment Deed, Business License/Izin Usaha, Business Identification Number / NIB, NPWP, Director’s ID card/KT
`, }, ], button: null, }, { title: 'Single Entry Visa - B211', titleDescription: 'Indonesia Visa & Immigration Specialists', content: [ { title: 'Who is this type of visa for ?', contentDescription: `

Single Entry Visit Visa – B211 is suitable for those of you who will visit Indonesia to conduct business talk , tourism, social culture etc. This visa is not valid for paid working purpose. B211 visa must be sponsored by a company in Indonesia who will act as guarantor, and cannot be sponsored by an Individuals.

Single Entry Visa – B211 will authomatically revoked once the visa holder has left or departed from Indonesia territory, even when validity period has not yet expired. 

First time length given is 60 (sixty) days which can be extended monthly up to 2 (two) times. Each extension will grant you 60 days (sixty)  days. In total, you can reach up to 6 (six) months staying in Indonesia.

`, }, { title: 'What are the benefits of having this visa ?', contentDescription: `

If you have this type of visa then you can stay for 6 months without having to leave Indonesia and without having to pay a levy / Levy of USD 100 per month to the government, as this is required for work visa holders. Another advantage is that holders of this visa can transfer / change the type of visa to another type of visa, such as a residence visa/KITAS for 1 year, either for work purposes or to spend retirement (retirement visa – C319).

`, }, { title: 'How is the procedure and how long the process is ?', contentDescription: `

This type of visa can be applied for by applicants who are outside Indonesia (offshore) or who are already in Indonesia (Onshore). After the applicant has all the necessary requirements and already has a sponsor/guarantor in Indonesia, the visa can be applied immediately, either by yourself or by using the professional services of an experienced and trusted visa consultant or agent. The length of the visa processing process in normal situations ranges from 3-7 working days, but during the COVID-19 pandemic the visa process is much longer and the procedure is often changing and confusing. However, even though the conditions faced during this pandemic are not easy to overcome, we are still able to complete our task well, which is to successfully obtain visas for our clients.

`, }, { title: 'After the visa approval is given, how long the visa can be used ? ', contentDescription: `

After your visa application has been granted by Indonesian immigration and the telex visa (e-Visa) has been issued, then you must use the visa (enter Indonesia) no later than 90 days after the visa was issued by Indonesian immigration. If during the 90 days you do not enter Indonesia, your visa will be forfeited / no longer valid. Thus you have to reapply the visa application if you want to enter Indonesia.

`, }, { title: 'Is a sponsor required to get this visa ?', contentDescription: `

That’s right, for this visa application it is required to have a guarantor/sponsor from an Indonesian citizen or a company in Indonesia and must attach company legality / sponsor’s personal data such as: Company Establishment Deed, Business License, Business Identification Number / NIB, NPWP, Director’s KTP, etc. and for those of you who do not have a sponsor, our company can be a sponsor for your visa application.

`, }, ], images: ['kitas-7.png'], card: null, content2: null, button: `Apply Now`, }, { title: 'Single Entry Visa Extension', titleDescription: 'Indonesia Visa & Immigration Specialists', content: [ { title: 'Who is this service intended for ?', contentDescription: `

For all of you foreigners who are already in Indonesia using a visit visa type B211 for the purpose of business, tourism or socio-cultural activities and need additional time to stay longer in Indonesia, you can extend your visa at the nearest immigration office to where you live to get permit of stay for the next 60 days after obtaining a permit from your original sponsor, and in the event that the original sponsor does not want to grant the permit for extension, then the local immigration authorities will not want to extend your visa.

This B 211 visa can actually be extended twice with the length of stay for each extension of 60 days, thus, the total length of stay for this type of visa is 6 months (180 days) without having to leave the territory of Indonesia. After staying for 6 months with this B211 visa, you can re-apply for a new same type of visa, thus, you can stay again for the next 6 months.

`, }, { title: 'What is the procedure for extending this B211 visa?', contentDescription: `

If you want to extend this B211 visit visa with help from a visa agent, it is recommended that you contact him no later than 2 weeks before the expiration date of your visa. The purpose is that the visa agent can prepare the necessary documents for applying for a visa extension to the immigration office.

After your passport has been submitted and processed at the immigration office for visa extension, you are required to come to the immigration office to do biometrics. You only are only obliged to come at the first extension and not for the second one. There are things that you must remember when you are going to come to the immigration office for biometrics. Foreigners applying for a visa extension are not allowed to wear shorts (for men) and sandals, while women are not allowed to wear mini clothes. When you come to the immigration office for biometrics, you will be guided by our staff who will accompany you during the process at the immigration office, so you don’t need to worry about coming to the immigration office.

`, }, ], images: null, card: [ `

SINGLE ENTRY VISA EXTENSION

B211

3.300.000 IDR

Price Includes

  • E-Visa Approval – From Immigration Authority
  • PNBP fee / Official Visa fee to Immigration
  • Sponsor letter / Invitation letter
  • Stay permit for 60 days
  • Agency Fee

Price Excludes

Sponsorship fee : 1.000.000 IDR

7 – 10 Working days – (Regular Process)

Requirement

  • Original passport
  • Stay address in Indonesia (hotel / house)
  • Return ticket
  • It requires you to come to the Immigration office 4 working days after submission for Photo & Biometric Taking

    Note :

    The price above is valid only for the Jakarta City Area

    `, ], content2: [ { title: 'What documents are needed to apply for an extension?', contentDescription: `

    To apply for a B211 visit visa extension at the immigration office, the following documents are required:

    1. Original Passport

    2. Residential address in Indonesia

    3. Return ticket

    If you need our assistance to extend your B211 visit visa, you can contact us via WhatsApp, email, or telephone to our office and our friendly team will be ready to help and arrange a meeting schedule with you at our office.

    `, }, ], button: null, }, { title: 'Multiple Entry Visa - D212', titleDescription: 'Indonesia Visa & Immigration Specialists', content: [ { title: 'Who is this type of Visa for ?', contentDescription: `

    For those of you who often go in and out of Indonesia for business, then using the Multiple Entry Business Visa – D212 is a very suitable choice for you, because this visa will be valid as a permit to enter and leave Indonesia for 1 year, with a length of stay for each visit is 60 day. After you stay 60 days then you are required to leave the territory of Indonesia and you can re-enter on another day using the visa and will be given a stay permit for the next 60 days. That’s how this type of visa works. And it is very important to know that this type of visa is not for work and is not allowed to carry out work activities for a salary, either in the office, factory or other places throughout Indonesia.

    `, }, { title: 'What are the benefits of having this Visa ?', contentDescription: `

    If you have this type of visa, it will be easier for you to enter Indonesia within 1 year. Where you no longer need to apply for a visa before entering Indonesia and there are no fees when entering, except for airport tax fees and other benefits, the process of checking immigration documents at the airport is simpler and faster.

    `, }, { title: 'How is the procedure and how long the process is ?', contentDescription: `

    This type of visa can be applied for by applicants who are outside Indonesia (offshore). After the applicant has all the necessary requirements and already has a sponsor/guarantor in Indonesia, the visa can be applied immediately, either by yourself or by using the professional services of an experienced and trusted visa consultant or agent. The length of the visa processing process in normal situations ranges from 7-14 working days.

    `, }, { title: 'After the Visa approval is given, how long the Visa can be used ?', contentDescription: `

    After your visa application has been granted by Indonesian immigration and the telex visa (e-Visa) has been issued, then you must use the visa (enter Indonesia) no later than 90 days after the visa was issued by Indonesian immigration. If during the 90 days you do not enter Indonesia, your visa will be forfeited / no longer valid. Thus you have to reapply the visa application if you want to enter Indonesia.

    `, }, { title: 'Is a Sponsor required to get this Visa ?', contentDescription: `

    That’s right, for this visa application it is required to have a guarantor/sponsor from a company in Indonesia and must attach sponsor company legalities such as: Company Establishment Deed, Business License, Business Identification Number / NIB, NPWP, Director’s KTP, etc. and for those of you who do not have a sponsor, our company can be a sponsor for your visa application.

    `, }, ], images: null, card: [ `

    MULTIPLE ENTRY VISA

    (BUSINESS)

    NORMAL PROCESS

    5.500.000 IDR

    Price Includes

    • E-Visa Approval – From Immigration Authority
    • PNBP fee / Official Visa fee to Immigration
    • Sponsor letter / Invitation letter
    • Sponsorship for 1 year
    • Agency Fee

    Processing Time

    7 – 14 Working days

    Requirement

    • Scanned colour of passport (identity page and passport cover)
    • Passport validity period is not less than 6 months
    • Vaccine certificate, evidence applicant is fully vaccinated
    • Colour passport photo
    • Stay address in Indonesia (hotel / house)
    • Return / through ticket
    • Bank Statement with minimum balance of 2000 USD or Equivalent
    `, `

    MULTIPLE ENTRY VISA

    (BUSINESS)

    EXPRESS PROCESS

    8.000.000 IDR

    Price Includes

    • E-Visa Approval – From Immigration Authority
    • PNBP fee / Official Visa fee to Immigration
    • Sponsor letter / Invitation letter
    • Sponsorship for 1 year
    • Agency Fee

    Processing Time

    3 – 5 Working days

    Requirement

    • Scanned colour of passport (identity page and passport cover)
    • Passport validity period is not less than 6 months
    • Vaccine certificate, evidence applicant is fully vaccinated
    • Colour passport photo
    • Stay address in Indonesia (hotel / house)
    • Return / through ticket
    • Bank Statement with minimum balance of 2000 USD or Equivalent
    `, ], content2: null, button: `Apply Now`, }, { title: 'Visa On Arrival (VOA) Extension', titleDescription: 'Indonesia Visa & Immigration Specialists', content: [ { title: 'Who is this service intended for?', contentDescription: `

    For all of you foreigners who are already in Indonesia using a Tourist visa (VOA) and need additional time to stay longer in Indonesia, you can extend your visa at the nearest immigration office to obtain a stay permit for the next 30 days. In order to apply for this extension, a guarantor and an application letter from the sponsor person or local company are required. Thus, you should ask for help from a visa agent if you do not have a sponsor who will help extend your visa.

    For all of you foreigners who are already in Indonesia using a Tourist visa (VOA) and need additional time to stay longer in Indonesia, you can extend your visa at the nearest immigration office to obtain a stay permit for the next 30 days. In order to apply for this extension, a guarantor and an application letter from the sponsor person or local company are required. Thus, you should ask for help from a visa agent if you do not have a sponsor who will help extend your visa.

    `, }, { title: 'Who is this service intended for?', contentDescription: `

    If you want to extend this VOA visa with help from a visa agent, it is recommended that you contact him no later than 10 days before the expiration date of your visa, the goal is that the visa agent can prepare the necessary documents for submitting your visa extension to the immigration office.

    After your passport has been submitted and processed at the immigration office for visa extension, you are required to come to the immigration office to do biometrics. There are things that you must remember when you are going to come to the immigration office for biometrics. Foreigners applying for a visa extension are not allowed to wear shorts (for men) and sandals, while women are not allowed to wear mini clothes. When you come to the immigration office for biometrics, you will be guided by our staff who will accompany you during the process at the immigration office, so you don’t need to worry about coming to the immigration office.

    `, }, { title: 'VISA ON ARRIVAL (VOA) COUNTRY LIST', contentDescription: `

    1. South Africa
    2. USA
    3. Saudi Arabia
    4. Argentina
    5. Australia
    6. Netherlands
    7. Belgium
    8. Brazil
    9. Brunei Darussalam
    10. Denmark
    11. Philippines
    12. Finland
    13. Hungary
    14. United Kingdom
    15. India
    16. Bahrain
    17. Austria
    18. Bulgaria
    19. Czech
    20. Columbi
    21. Albania
    22. Andorra

    23. Chile
    24. Japan
    25. Germany
    26. Cambodia
    27. Canada
    28. South Korea
    29. Laos
    30. Malaysia
    31. Mexico
    32. Myanmar
    33. Norway
    34. France
    35. Poland
    36. Qatar
    37. New Zealand
    38. Singapore
    39. Estonia
    40. Hongkong
    41. Ireland
    42. Croatia
    43. Maldives
    44. Ecuador

    45. Iceland
    46. Leichtenstein
    47. Italy
    48. Seycheless
    49. Spain
    50. Sweden
    51. Switzerland
    52. Taiwan
    53. Thailand
    54. China
    55. Tunisia
    56. Turkiye
    57. United Arab Emirates
    58. Vietnam
    59. Timor Leste
    60. Latvia
    61. Lithuania
    62. Luxembourg
    63. Malta
    64. Portugal
    65. Monaco
    66. Palestine

    67. San Marino
    68. Suriname
    69. Rumania
    70. Cyprus
    71. Slovakia
    72. Slovenia
    73. Greece
    74. Belarus
    75. Bosnia and Herzegovina
    76. Kuwait
    77. Egypt
    78. Morocco
    79. Oman
    80. Peru
    81. Russia
    82. Serbia
    83. Ukraine
    84. Jordan
    85. Uzbekistan
    86. The Vatican

    `, }, ], images: ['kitas-9.png'], card: [ `

    visa on Arrival

    voa extension

    1.500.000 IDR

    Price Includes

    • Stay permit for another 30 days
    • Sponsorship fee
    • Agency fee

    Processing Time

    7 – 10 Working Days (Regular Process)

    Requirement

    • Original passport
    • Stay address in Indonesia
    • Return ticket
    • It requires you to come to the Immigration office 4 working days after submission for Photo & Biometric Taking

    Note

    The price above is valid only for the Jakarta City Area

    `, ], content2: null, button: null, }, { title: 'Calling Visa Indonesia', titleDescription: 'Indonesia Visa & Immigration Specialists', content: [ { title: 'VISA FOR SPECIAL COUNTRIES', contentDescription: `

    Calling Visa Indonesia is one of the most Popular Visa in Indonesia, this kind of Visa is addressed to Special Countries that conditions or circumstances are considered to have a certain level of vulnerability in terms of IPOLEKSOSBUDHANKAM (Ideology, Politics, Economy, Social Culture, Defense & Security) and immigration aspects.

    The procedure for visa application to the countries below is different from the procedure for visa application to other countries, in terms of the amount of cost and the length of process. The said countries are: Nigeria, Cameroon, Liberia, Somalia, Israel, Afghanistan, North Korea, and Guinea. For all of you foreigners who are going to visit Indonesia and need a visa, we can help you get the visit for both short visit and long term stay visas. The length of process to obtain the visit visa ranges from 12-15 working days.

    However, for the countries aforementioned, even though they have succeeded in obtaining entry visas from the immigration authority in Indonesia or have been given E-Visa approval, upon arrival they still have to be picked up or escorted by our team at the airport. If you are not picked up or escorted, then you will likely face many obstacles when interviewed by immigration officials and be refused to enter by officers at the airport. Therefore, to avoid rejection at the entry, we provide a one-package service, namely processing to get Visa approval and pick-up on arrival. To ensure smooth travel to Indonesia for citizens of the 8 countries aforementioned, we strongly recommend to use an escort service upon arrival.

    Do not hesitate to contact us if you need other questions regarding this kind of Visa. Our friendly team is ready to help you to obtain this Indonesia Calling Visa for you and your loves one.

    `, }, ], images: null, card: null, content2: null, button: null, }, { title: 'Second Home Visa (KITAS)', titleDescription: 'Indonesia Visa & Immigration Specialists', content: [ { title: 'Who is this visa intended for?', contentDescription: `

    The Indonesian Immigration Authority issued a Second Home Visa policy aimed at foreigners belonging to the upper middle class economy category who are interested and wish to stay in Indonesia. This new type of visa was officially issued as of December 24, 2022, as a replacement for the Retirement Visa already existed (available) more than 20 years ago.

    The most striking/contrast difference between the two types of visas is in terms of the minimum amount of savings that must be owned by this visa applicant. In the past, retirement visa applicants were required to have a minimum savings fund of USD 15,000 – 18,000, but now they are required to have funds cash stored in banks in Indonesia in the amount of IDR 2 billion. The requirement for the proof of fund of IDR 2 billion may be difficult for ordinary foreigners, but it is not a problem for middle and upper economic class foreigners. Thus, this new policy breakthrough may be able to attract rich foreigners to stay longer in Indonesia, namely 5 or 10 years and can be extended.

    `, }, { title: 'Second Home Visa Background', contentDescription: `

    1.  As a replacement for a Retirement Visa (stay permit for seniors)
    2. Accommodating foreigners who will live in Indonesia due to extreme weather in their country
    3. Encouraging economic growth in Indonesia (Recession/Inflation)
    4. Developing property businesses in Indonesia

    `, }, { title: 'How long is the validity period of this Second Home Stay Permit?', contentDescription: `

    The validity period of the second home stay permit is 5 or 10 years and can be extended. What are the requirements that must be prepared?

    1. Visa applicants are citizens of Visa on Arrival/VOA subjects (that can be given by VOA)
    2. Proof of having funds at the bank in the name of the foreign visa applicant/guarantor with a minimum amount of IDR 2 billion (equivalent)
    3. Curriculum Vitae / CV
    4. Guarantor/Sponsor Data
    5. Resident Identity Card (KTP) or Business Permit / NIB of the sponsor company
    6. Validity period of Passport is more than 36 months
    7. Photo 4×6 (white background)
    8. Marriage Certificate (husband/wife), for follower
    9. Birth certificate or family card (children/parents), for following family
    10. Visa for the second home of the person being followed
    11. Passport & photo (follower), if there is a family of follower
    12. Vaccine Certificate (full dose)
    13. Residential address in Indonesia (Hotel/House)
    14. Booking tickets to enter Indonesia 

    For consultation regarding the procedure, you are welcome to contact our friendly team at the WhatsApp number listed on the website or via email.

    `, }, ], images: null, card: null, content2: [ { title: 'What are the requirements to apply for this visa ?', contentDescription: `

    To apply for a visa you must attach the following documents :

    1. Scan color passport (identity page and passport cover).
    2. Passport validity period is not less than 18 months, for a 1 year KITAS
    3. Vaccine certificate with QR code, evidence applicant is fully vaccinated.
    4. Recent photos, red background
    5. Have a pension fund of around USD 1500/month or Savings in a Bank worth USD 15000
    6. Residence address in Indonesia / Residence rental agreement
    7. 2 ID cards of household assistants / maid
    8. Legalities of sponsor company such as: Company Establishment Deed, Business License/Izin Usaha, Business Identification Number / NIB, NPWP, Director’s ID card/KTP.
    `, }, ], button: null, }, { title: 'Spouse Visa / KITAS', titleDescription: 'Indonesia Visa & Immigration Specialists', content: [ { title: '', contentDescription: `

    This type of Spouse Visa / KITAS is valid for a stay of 1 year and can be extended every year, with 5 continuous extensions for 6 years, without having to leave the territory of Indonesia for the period of 6 years. And for those of you who already have a KITAS and are interested in getting a Permanent Stay Visa/ KITAP, you can apply for a KITAP when your marriage is 2 years old. Likewise, if you are interested in applying for Indonesian citizenship, you can apply after you have lived for 5 consecutive years using a KITAS and you are not required to have a KITAP at the time of applying for citizenship.

    `, }, { title: 'Who is this type of visa for ?', contentDescription: `

    This type of Spouse Visa/ KITAS  is provided by the government for foreign citizens who are legally married to Indonesian citizens and intend to stay in Indonesia for 1 year or a long period of time.

    `, }, { title: 'What are the benefits of having this visa ?', contentDescription: `

    If you have this type of visa, you can stay in Indonesia for 6 consecutive years without having to leave Indonesia and have the opportunity to get a Permanent Stay Visa / KITAP after living for several years in Indonesia. Among other advantages are :

    1. You can get a driver’s license / SIM valid for 1 year
    2. You can open an account at a local bank
    3. You can apply for a credit card
    4. You can get an exit permit/ MERP for 1 year
    5. Register a mobile phone
    `, }, { title: 'How is the procedure and how long the process is ?', contentDescription: `

    This Spouse Visa can be applied for by applicants who are outside Indonesia (offshore) or who are already in Indonesia (Onshore). After the applicant completes all the necessary requirements, the visa can be applied immediately, either by yourself or by using the professional services of an experienced and trusted visa consultant or agent. The processing time for a Spouse visa in normal situations ranges from 1 – 2 weeks, but during the covid-19 pandemic the process of getting a visa approval is sometimes much longer because the procedures and requirements often change.

    `, }, { title: 'After the visa approval is given, how long the visa can be used ? ', contentDescription: `

    After your visa application has been granted by Indonesian immigration and the telex visa (e-Visa) has been issued, then you must use the visa (enter Indonesia) no later than 90 days after the visa was issued by Indonesian immigration. If during the 90 days you do not enter Indonesia, your visa will be forfeited / no longer valid. Thus you have to reapply the visa application if you want to enter Indonesia

    `, }, { title: 'Is a sponsor required to get this visa ?', contentDescription: `

    To get this spouse visa, you are required to have a sponsor, and in this case, your partner who is an Indonesian citizen must be the sponsor. Your sponsor can not only be a sponsor to get a KITAS but also to get a Permanent Stay Visa / KITAP.

    `, }, ], images: ['kitas-10.png', 'kitas-11.png'], card: null, content2: [ { title: 'What are the requirements to apply for this visa ?', contentDescription: `

    To apply for a visa you must attach the following documents :

    1. Scan color passport (identity page and passport cover).
    2. Passport validity period is not less than 18 months, for a 1 year KITAS
    3. Vaccine certificate with QR code, evidence applicant is fully vaccinated
    4. Recent photos, red background
    5. Health / Travel insurance
    6. Residence address in Indonesia
    7. Marriage Certificate
    8.  Savings account of sponsor
    9. Marriage permit from the Embassy of a foreign country in Indonesia (for foreigners who have carried out their marriage in Indonesia).
    10. Sponsor documents such as : ID card / KTP, Family card, savings books of Indonesian Spouse.
    `, }, ], button: null, }, { title: 'Study Visa / KITAS', titleDescription: 'Indonesia Visa & Immigration Specialists', content: [ { title: '', contentDescription: `

    Indonesia has opened the entrance to foreign students who want study at one of the universities in Indonesia. For a long time, universities in Indonesia are much in demand by foreign students who want to deepen certain knowledge in Indonesia. The enthusiasm of students from abroad to study in Indonesia cannot be separated from the role and policy of the immigration of Indonesia, which provides many conveniences to foreign students to obtain a study visa in Indonesia. Study visa can be granted by the Indonesian government for a 1 year stay, accompanied by KITAS. These visa and KITAS can be extended every year, without having to leave Indonesia. Foreign students who are going to study in Indonesia must be able to show proof of having sufficient funds for living expenses while living in Indonesia, and they must have obtained proof of admission as a student at their chosen school. We can help you to apply for the visa and take care of all your residence permit documents in Indonesia.

    `, }, { title: 'What are the requirements to apply for this visa', contentDescription: `

    1. Passport scan
    2. Latest Rapport scan
    3. Statement letter declaring the concerned person will not work while studying
    4. Guaranteed letter of financing from parents
    5. Certificate from Schools in Indonesia
    6. Parents’ passports scan
    7. Currently applicable KITAS/Visa scan (for renewal)
    8. Statement letter from a doctor (swab anti-gen/PCR), you may choose one.
    9. The application letter must contain the residential address abroad and in Indonesia
    10. School’s current account/mutation of the last 3 months.

    `, }, { title: 'When the visa applicant is not in the country (abroad), there are additional documents, as follows', contentDescription: `
    1. Vaccine certificate with QR code, evidence applicant is fully vaccinated.
    `, }, ], images: ['kitas-12.png', 'kitas-13.png'], card: [ `

    STUDY VISA

    (1 YEAR KITAS)

    8.500.000 IDR

    Price Excludes

    • $150 USD Mandatory Visa Fee / PNBP
    • Sponsorship

    Price Includes

    • Recommendation Letter from Ministry of Education
    • E-Visa approval – C316 from Immigration Authority in Jakarta
    • E-KITAS from local immigration
    • STM (Police Report Certificate)
    • SKTT (Residency Certificate) from Civil Registry Office

    Processing Time

    • 40 working days for processing in Indonesia
    • For express service 30 business days there will be additional fees

    Study Visa Renewal

    • Renewal every year of 6.500.000 IDR, yet you do not need to leave the country
    • For renewal must start processing minimum 2 month before the visa expires

    Note

    • The price above is valid only for the Jakarta City Area
    • The price above does not include express process cost (if necessary)
    `, ], content2: null, button: null, }, { title: 'Freelance Work Visa (KITAS)', titleDescription: 'Indonesia Visa & Immigration Specialists', content: [ { title: '', contentDescription: `

    For those of you who need a work visa / KITAS for freelance work in Indonesia and don’t have a sponsor, don’t worry! because we can help you to get a work visa / KITAS for 6 months. For foreign nationals who will work freelance in Bali, Jakarta or other cities in Indonesia. The following is a list of job titles or types of work that we can help to get a work visa / KITAS sponsored by our company.

    `, }, { title: 'The following is List of types of work/position', contentDescription: `
    • Research and Development Advisor
    • Shooting Coach
    • Show Manager
    • Singer
    • Softball Coach
    • Sport Consultant
    • Sport Science Manager
    • Surfing Coach
    • Swimming Coach
    • Synchronized Swimming Coach
    • Table Tennis Coach
    • Taekwondo Coach
    • Tour Manager
    • Tourism Facility Manager
    • Volleyball Coach
    • Volleyball Player
    • Wushu Coach
    • Film Director
    • Fleet Manager
    • Football Coach
    • Football Player
    • General Manager
    • Golf Coach
    • Judo Coach
    • Karate Guide
    • Diving Manager
    • Karate Coach
    • Ligting Director
    • Magician
    • Marketing advisor
    • Marketing Manager
    • Music Director
    • Musician
    • Operations Manager
    • Paddle Coach
    • Platform Diving Coach
    • Polo Coach
    • Referee
    • Acrobat
    • Actress / Actor
    • ADS Model
    • Fashion Model
    • Art Director
    • Athletic Coach
    • Badminton Coach
    • Basketball Coach
    • Basketball Player
    • Bodyguard
    • Bowling Coach
    • Boxer
    • Boxing Coach
    • Boxing Promotor
    • Circus Performer
    • Cruise Manager
    • Dancer
    • Disc Jockey
    • Diving Coach
    `, }, ], images: ['kitas-14.png', 'kitas-15.png'], card: [ `

    STUDY VISA

    (1 YEAR KITAS)

    8.500.000 IDR

    Price Excludes

    • $150 USD Mandatory Visa Fee / PNBP
    • Sponsorship

    Price Includes

    • Recommendation Letter from Ministry of Education
    • E-Visa approval – C316 from Immigration Authority in Jakarta
    • E-KITAS from local immigration
    • STM (Police Report Certificate)
    • SKTT (Residency Certificate) from Civil Registry Office

    Processing Time

    • 40 working days for processing in Indonesia
    • For express service 30 business days there will be additional fees

    Study Visa Renewal

    • Renewal every year of 6.500.000 IDR, yet you do not need to leave the country
    • For renewal must start processing minimum 2 month before the visa expires

    Note

    • The price above is valid only for the Jakarta City Area
    • The price above does not include express process cost (if necessary)
    `, ], content2: [ { title: 'What are the requirements to apply for this visa ?', contentDescription: `

    To apply for a visa you must attach the following documents :

    1. Scanned copy of Passport full page 1 (Identity Page) and cover (Must be in color).
    2. Passport valid for at least 18 months and a minimum of 2 blank pages.
    3. Certificate of a university degree or relevant qualification.
    4. Address in indonesia (hotel/villa).
    5. Domicile Letter with address in Indonesia
    6. Photo with red background.
    7. Offshore application – Full dose Vaccine Certificate with QR code.
    8. Indonesia Latest Visa stamping ( For Onshore application )
    9. Working Activity Area in Indonesia.
    10. Working Title / Position
    11. Curriculum Vitae / CV
    12. Refference Letter from previous company /work place
    13. Bank account statement or savings in a Bank minimum balance IDR 20,000,000 (twenty million rupiah) or USD 1500
    `, }, ], button: null, }, { title: 'Citizenship', titleDescription: 'Indonesia Visa & Immigration Specialists', content: [ { title: '', contentDescription: `

    For you who want to apply for Indonesian citizenship and have met the criteria, we are ready to help to apply for the citizenship. Our team is very experienced for decades in this field and has successfully assisted many clients in obtaining the Indonesian citizenship.

    For foreign nationals who are officially married to an Indonesian citizen and have children from their mixed marriage (marriage between Indonesian citizens and foreign nationals), becoming an Indonesian citizen is the best choice if you are still a foreigner. Usually, foreigners will decide to become Indonesian citizens after seeing the benefits and interests for themselves and their families.
    The Citizenship of Indonesia may be acquired through marriage with an Indonesian citizens. This is a new method provided by the new Indonesia´s 2006 Citizenship Law in acquiring a Citizenship of Indonesia. The Indonesian spouse can be the sponsor for his/her spouse to turn status to Indonesian citizen.

    This article will hopefully useful for foreigners married to Indonesian spouse who are considering to relinquish his/her current citizenship and wish to seek the possibility of becoming an Indonesian.

    `, }, { title: 'General Eligibility', contentDescription: `

    Application for Indonesian citizenship may be forwarded by  the applicant upon meeting the following  general eligibility:

    1. Applicant must legally married to an Indonesian citizen;
    2. At the time of forwarding the application, the applicant has resided in Indonesian territory for at least 5 (five) consecutive years or at least 10 (ten) years non continuously. This is prerequisite to the citizenship application;
    3. The Indonesian citizenship will not caused double citizenship.
    `, }, { title: 'What is the process ?', contentDescription: `

    Application for citizenship should be forwarded in Indonesia in writing by the applicant using Bahasa Indonesia, on paper affixed with sufficient duty stamp and addressed to the local district office of Ministry of Law and Human Rights having jurisdiction over the applicant´s residence.

    `, }, { title: 'How long the process to get The Indonesian citizenship ? ', contentDescription: `

    The processing time to get the Indonesian citizenship is about 3 months upon receipt of completed application, depending on the completeness of the documents as requirements that must be attached.

    The approved-applicant required to return his/her previous citizenship documentation to the foreign embassy in Indonesian as soon as he/she obtains the Indonesian citizenship.

    `, }, { title: 'What If You´re Not Married to an Indonesian Citizen? ', contentDescription: `

    You need to go with naturalization process upon meeting the following requirements:

    1. At least aged 18 (eighteen) or married.
    2. As a Permanent Stay Visa /KITAP card holder in Indonesia.
    3. At the time of forwarding the application has resided in Indonesian territory for at least 5 (five) consecutive years or at least 10 (ten) years intermittently;
    4. Sound in health and mind;
    5. Able to speak Bahasa Indonesia and acknowledges the state basic principles of Pancasila and the 1945 Constitution;
    6. Was never legally prosecuted due to acts of crime and sentenced jail for 1 (one) yearn or more;
    7. Upon acquiring Indonesian Citizenship will relinquish any other citizenship;
    8. As a shareholder in a company in Indonesia
    9. Pay a naturalization fee to the Government Treasury.

    Application for naturalization should be forwarded in Indonesia in writing by the applicant using Bahasa Indonesia, on paper affixed with sufficient duty stamp and addressed to the President of the Republic of Indonesia through the Minister of Law and Human Rights.

    Copies of the Presidential Decree on naturalization and report on the declaration of allegiance ceremony becomes legal proof of Indonesian citizenship for a person who has been granted citizenship.

    `, }, ], images: null, card: null, content2: null, button: null, }, { title: 'Permanent Stay Visa / KITAP', titleDescription: 'Indonesia Visa & Immigration Specialists', content: [ { title: '', contentDescription: `

    For those of you who hold a Residence visa / KITAS in Indonesia which is valid for one year, you can apply for a Permanent Stay Permit / KITAP which is valid for 5 years if you meet the requirements and meet the criteria as a candidate for a KITAP holder. If you meet the requirements, then the KITAP can be issued by Indonesian immigration, so you don’t have to extend your residence visa/KITAS every year. Permanent Stay Visa / KITAP can be extended every 5 years or at the time of the next extension you can also apply for a lifetime stay visa / KITAP, so you don’t have to renew every 5 years. The process of obtaining a KITAP can only be done by way of conversion, which is only for foreigners who already have a KITAS and the KITAS status is still valid at the time the KITAP is submitted.

    `, }, { title: 'To whom KITAP can be given ? ', contentDescription: `

    KITAP can be given to :

    1. Foreigners who hold KITAS as clergy, workers, investors, seniors
    2. Family due to mixed marriage (between Indonesian citizens & foreigners)
    3. Husband, wife and/or children of foreigners holding KITAP
    4. Foreigners who are ex- Indonesian citizens and ex-children with dual citizenship of the Republic of Indonesia.
    `, }, { title: 'What is the advantage of owning KITAP ?', contentDescription: `

    If you already have a KITAP, you will get several conveniences in the following ways :

    1. Get an ID card and family card that is valid for 5 years
    2. You can get a driver’s license / SIM valid for 5 years
    3. You can open an account at a local bank
    4. You can apply for a credit card
    5. You can get an exit permit/ MERP for two years
    6. You can own property together with your partner who is an Indonesian citizen.
    7. Register a mobile phone
    `, }, { title: 'How long the process to get KITAP ? ', contentDescription: `

    The processing time to get a KITAP is about 2 – 3 months, depending on the completeness of the documents as requirements that must be attached and also depending on the domicile area where the applicant lives.

    `, }, { title: 'Are KITAP holders allowed to work ?', contentDescription: `

    KITAP holders are allowed to work in a company or carry out work activities in a workplace such as an office building, factory or school for those who work as teachers, after they have a work permit/ IMTA from the Ministry of Manpower.

    To get a work permit / IMTA the company that employs foreign workers is required to pay a DPKK / levy to the Ministry of Manpower in the amount of USD 100 per month of work or USD 1200 for a period of 12 months which is paid in full upfront and cannot be paid in installments .

    `, }, { title: 'Is KITAP become void due to divorce ?', contentDescription: `

    True, the occurrence of a divorce with an Indonesian partner can cause your KITAP to be canceled. Unless the age of marriage is 10 years or more. In the event that the age of marriage is 10 years old, your next KITAP sponsor will be your new wife.

    `, }, { title: 'Can foreigners holding a permanent stay permit / KITAP establish a local PT company?', contentDescription: `

    For foreigners holding a Permanent Stay Permit/KITAP can establish a local PT company and serve as a director but cannot own shares, thus he/she cannot obtain an Investor Visa/KITAS.

    `, }, { title: 'Can a holder of Permanent Stay Permit /KITAP valid for 5 years get an unlimited KITAP?', contentDescription: `

    Yes, he/she can, a holder of regular Permanent Stay Permit/KITAP can get an unlimited KITAP after spending the first 5 years of his/her KITAP validity.

    `, }, { title: 'Does a holder of unlimited KITAP no longer need to renew his/her KITAP every 5 years?', contentDescription: `

    Yes, there is no need to renew, he/she only needs to report to the immigration office every 5 years for data renewal at the immigration office.

    `, }, { title: 'Can a holder of KITAP get Citizenship/WNI?', contentDescription: `

    Not all of them can. Those who can get an Indonesian citizen is only the holder of Temporary Stay Permit / KITAS who is married to an Indonesian citizen and or the holder of Permanent Stay Permit/KITAP with a position as director and shareholder in foreign companies in Indonesia, after living in Indonesia for 5 consecutive years using a Temporary Stay Permit/KITAS

    `, }, { title: 'If we change our home address, do we have to notify the immigration office?', contentDescription: `

    Yes, you are required to report to the immigration office where your Stay Permit Card/KITAS/KITAP is issued.

    `, }, { title: 'What things can make a Permanent Stay Permit Card/KITAP invalid/forfeited?', contentDescription: `

    A Permanent Stay Permit/ KITAP can be canceled for the following reasons:

    1. Discontinuation of marriage relationship of a foreigner who is legally married to an Indonesian citizen due to divorce and/or a court judgment, except for 10 years or more marriages.
    2. Leaving the territory of Indonesia for more than 1 (one) year or not intending to re-enter the territory of Indonesia.
    3. Subject to deportation or death
    4. Conducting activities that endanger state security.
    5. Providing incorrect information in submitting an application for a Permanent Stay Permit/KITAP
    6. Not extending the Permanent Stay Permit/ KITAP after 5 (five) years.
    `, }, ], images: ['kitas-16.png'], card: [ `

    PERMANENT STAY PERMIT (KITAP)

    (SPOUSE KITAP – 5 YEARS)

    23.000.000 IDR

    Price Excludes

    • Sponsorship

    Price Includes

    • Stay Permit Card / KITAP for 5 Years
    • Multiple Exit Re-entry Permit / MERP for 2 years
    • National ID card / KTP
    • Family Registry / Kartu Keluarga
    • Agency Fee
    • Mandatory Visa Fee / PNBP

    Processing Time

    30 Working Days

    Visa Renewal

    • Renewal every 5 years, yet you do not need to leave the country
    • For renewal must start processing minimum 1 month before the visa expires

    Note

    • The price above is valid only for the Jakarta City Area
    • The price does not include express process cost (if necessary)
    • House rental agreement minimum for 2 years
    `, `

    INVESTOR KITAP

    (5 YEARS)

    35.000.000 IDR

    Price Excludes

    • Sponsorship

    Price Includes

    • Stay Permit Card / KITAP for 5 Years
    • Multiple Exit Re-entry Permit / MERP for 2 years
    • National ID card / KTP
    • Family Registry / Kartu Keluarga
    • Agency Fee
    • Mandatory Visa Fee / PNBP

    Processing Time

    30 Working Days

    Visa Renewal

    • Renewal every 5 years, yet you do not need to leave the country
    • For renewal must start processing minimum 1 month before the visa expires

    Note

    • The price above is valid only for the Jakarta City Area
    • The price does not include express process cost (if necessary)
    • Passport validity period is not less than 30 months
    • House rental agreement minimum for 2 years
    • Domicile letter from building management/building owner
    `, ], content2: [ { title: 'To apply for a visa you must attach the following documents :', contentDescription: `
    1. Original passport
    2. Passport is still valid for not less than 30 months at the time of application for KITAP
    3. A valid KITAS, and those who have lived with a KITAS for 13 months are also allowed to apply for a KITAP.
    4. Last SKTT
    5. Certificate from the Lurah stating that the KITAP applicant does reside at that address and is still married to his wife/husband.
    6. Copy of marriage permit from the Embassy of a foreign country in Indonesia (for foreigners who have carried out their marriage in Indonesia). This letter is very important for immigration authorities and if it is not there because it is lost, it will be an obstacle for submitting a KITAP. Or the immigration office may be able to provide a solution by requiring the applicant to pay extra to the immigration office for the lack of these requirements.
    7. House rental agreement letter
    8. Marriage Certificate
    9. ID card & family card (owned by Indonesian spouse)
    10. A survey of the location of residence will be carried out by the immigration office, the immigration office will take a photo of the husband and wife directly at the residence of the KITAP applicant, for data verification to make a report on the Examination Procedure / BAP
    11. The age of marriage has reached 2 years at the time of submitting the KITAP.
    `, }, ], button: null, }, ]; export default visa;
